summary:
Freelance choreographer (present)
Head of Dance and Movement Department at the Jeugdtheaterhuis Zuid-Holland 2006-2016
Performer Instant Composition at the Contemporary Dance Platform 2009-2013
Organiser and Coach for the Rabobank Young Talent Competition "Be a Star!" 
Member of Arts Education panel at the MIJ Museum in IJsselstein 2015-present
Contributor as writer on dance to book "Danswetenschap in Nederland"

publications.name: Audience Participation in Dance Performances: Why Bother?

profile_positions.description:
My choreographic work reflects the fragility of the human condition. My characters are ordinary people, coping heroically in difficult situations. For I am continuously amazed and in awe at the struggles people face in their lives.
As a choreographer I am averse to established structures and conventions. I enjoy exploring the surreal reality of the subjective and unconscious. There is a magic and poetry inherent in the living of life, and this I want my audience to experience. I use metaphors, references to iconic imagery and humour, often ironic, to communicate this. I hope in this way to take my audience on a journey, so they will discover a personal and deeper meaning to the narrative that is unfolding before their eyes. 
In 2012, as part of my  Masters in Art Education, I researched the effects of interacting with the public during dance performances. Public participation is a surprisingly powerful tool, capable of galvanising the audience’s emotions, which is why I like to use it. Sometimes the dancers in my pieces perform amidst the audience so the sensual experience of watching is heightened. Sometimes the audience is given an object to look after or a task to carry out which has a particular relevance or symbolic value for the piece. 
Below are photos from pieces which I choreographed in collaboration with the dancers. Some of the pieces were conceived by me. Others were collaborations with artists from various disciplines during which we explored the underlying theme as a team. 
If you click on the photos you can read about the various pieces and the issues they were raising.
profile_positions.title: choreographer and dance coach

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities :
•	Developing dance curricula for primary and secondary education students
•	Developing “bewegingstheater” curriculum for secondary education students
•	Providing artistic and didactic coaching to a team of ten dance and mime teachers at six different locations in the province of Zuid-Holland
•	Determining the artistic criteria for student performances
•	Visiting dance academies to talk about the Jeugdtheaterhuis dance policy

•	2002-2016	Movement composition teacher at the Jeugdtheaterhuis Zuid-Holland to students aged 10- 18. In the classes we researched the combination of dance, visual imagery and the spoken word. The classes culminated in performances at the end of the scholastic year.

2009-2010		parttime coordinator at the headquarters of the JTH in Gouda
			Responsibilities :
•	Consulting with teachers and management
•	Liaison person for parents and students
•	Resolving conflicts between students and teachers
•	Attending to visiting guests
•	Providing introductory and end-of-season talks to students and families
•	Organising schedules, studios and substitute teachers
profile_positions.title: Head of movement and dance department (2006-2016)

profile_positions.description:
Article "Audience Participation in Dance Performances: Why Bother?"

The article investigates the views of choreographers with experience in audience participation. The information gathered from the interviews suggests that interaction helps an audience become more motivated and attentive in their choices, arouses their emotions and generates energy. An intense relationship sometimes develops between audience and performers, allowing for audiences to be manipulated into undertaking actions they would not normally consider. The article also considers the dilemmas around ethics and authorship that arise for choreographers when interaction is employed.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Writer

profile_positions.description:
Project manager (together with Emmy Wouters) of dance-and-film educative project "Dance Your Clip!" This week-long workshop in the Bijlmermeer for children aged 8 – 12 will be broadened out by het Krater Theater into a school project in the area
Responsibilities :
•	concept initiator : artistic and didactic 
•	contacting contrator and partners
•	writing and submitting grant requests
•	providing leadership to team of seven teachers
•	developing system of evaluation
profile_positions.title: Project manager/coordinator
